item.title: Today’s Wordle #1587: Hints And Answer For October 23, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1587 for October 23, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 23, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1587 gives most players a challenge, though it will be easier than recent puzzles. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.4 guesses out of 6 to get. That makes it just a bit easier than October 22’s 4.8-guess average.

General Wordle Hints For October 23

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: It contains a repeated consonant.
  • Hint 2: Commonly found in workshops or toolboxes.
  • Hint 3: Can refer to both a device and a training exercise.
  • Hint 4: You might need it to make a hole

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1587 for October 23, 2025

Starter Words For October 23, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • CRISP
  • BUILD
  • TRAIL
  • THIRD

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1587 On October 23, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: DRILL

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1586 on October 22, 2025:

Answer: STUNT

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1587?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 24 will be Wordle Game #1588.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: New Fortnite PS5 Bundle Expected to Arrive on Black Friday 2025
item.content:encoded:
A new Fortnite PS5 Bundle is rumoured to be available for purchase on Black Friday 2025, with an expected release on November 21.

Fortnite has been receiving a whole bunch of content lately, with their Fortnitemares 2025 event featuring the most collabs in the event’s history, and Doja Cat being featured as a mini-boss at the event. Along with this, it seems Fortnite has been working on some exclusive content for the rumoured PS5 bundle.

Fortnite’s Flowering Chaos Bundle for PS5 Will Feature 8 Exclusive Cosmetic Items

As reported by Dealabs, a new PS5 Fortnite Bundle is expected to arrive during Black Friday 2025, just as it did in 2024. The bundle will include a PS5 Slim Standard (with disc drive) Chassis E Console. It will also feature eight exclusive cosmetic items, which are worth 5,000 V-Bucks, and an additional 1,000 V-Bucks for the buyers of the bundle to spend in the game.

New PS5 Fortnite Bundle Pricing and Availability

As mentioned above, the New Fortnite Flowering Chaos Bundle is expected to release on November 21, 2025. The bundle is expected to be available in North America; availability in Europe hasn’t been confirmed yet. Coming to the pricing, just like Fortnite Cobalt Star, the Flowering Chaos Bundle should receive a launch promotion. The price for this bundle has reportedly been set at $449.99 USD, $100 below the current price of this model.

In other news, a recent Fortnite leak claims that a Springfield map is coming to Fortnite on November 1 as part of a mini-season update. What are your thoughts on a new Fortnite PS5 Bundle arriving for Black Friday 2025? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Ubisoft Subsidiary Massive Entertainment Is Laying Off Staff
item.content:encoded:
Massive Entertainment, the Ubisoft subsidiary studio responsible for games such as The Division and Star Wars Outlaws, has announced that it is laying off a number of employees.

In a post on social media, the studio called it a “voluntary career transition program”.

“As part of our ongoing evolution and long-term planning, we have recently realigned our teams and resources to strengthen our roadmap, ensuring our continued focus on The Division franchise and the technologies, including Snowdrop and Ubisoft Connect, that power our games,” they said.

“To support this transition responsibly, we introduced a voluntary career transition program, giving eligible team members the opportunity to take their next career step on their own terms, supported by a comprehensive package that includes financial and career assistance.”

Massive Entertainment says that it “remains fully committed to our roadmap and to creating great experiences for players around the world, including The Division 2, The Division 2: Survivors, The Division Resurgence, and The Division 3. These projects continue with strength, focus, and ambition, and we look forward to sharing more in the future.”

The decision to “realign” comes just after the launch of the Ubisoft-Tencent subsidiary Vantage Studios. That studio, which will oversee the Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, and Rainbow Six Siege franchises, is the first of the company’s planned “creative houses.” As of publishing, it’s unclear what the next steps for the creative houses plan will be, and what games will be grouped.
